Key Arguments: The legislation is seen as a form of censorship that violates basic human rights to information.
The submission compares the proposed legislation to censorship in Nazi Germany.
There is a belief that the legislation supports a global agenda for control by organizations like the World Health Organisation, World Economic Forum, and the United Nations.
The submission argues that the legislation will lead to a lack of freedom of speech and could result in punitive measures similar to those in China.
There is concern about the influence of international organizations on Australian politics and the potential conflicts of interest among politicians.
Notable Quotes: I strongly oppose any form of censorship in Australia. I do not support this legislation.
Censorship violates the basic human right to information.
This is a dangerous Bill and will propel Australia... into a place that will have no freedom of speech other than what we are told is truth.
